page.title: 18Church of Christ the King
page.content: In{1955 Rev. P. S. Lewis}decided the Parish should build own church using local craftsmen.{David Evelyn Nye's design was chosen. Tent like building dropping down, surrounding Holy Table. Constructed of 26 massive wooden trusses- 20 planks laminated together. Roof- 50,000 tiles. Simple Altar, 2 blocks Portland stone, 1 3/4 tons weight. Pedestal carved with Greek letters CH1. RO. Kneelers worked by Young Wives Fellowship. Font- 1 block Portland Stone given by local Scout/ Guide Companies.Designs from Art College students. Pews simple design, Douglas Fir assembled and polished by Parish members. Organ originally St. Stephen's Church, Southwark, about 1880. Coloured West window of Autunque glass- idea of creation. Two vestries. Priest's vestry contains special garments.{Vicar:Rev. A. Lury since1981
